display_asset.caption: Handguns for sale in Bridgeton, Mo., last year.

summaries.body: Guns sales soared on Black Friday. On a day when an armed standoff in Colorado drew national attention, the F.B.I. processed a record number of background checks.
The city of Chennai, India, has been declared a disaster zone because of deadly flooding from relentless rain.
A recall of foods containing celery is being expanded to grocery stores in more than a dozen states amid an E. coli outbreak, the Food and Drug Administration announced.

display_asset.caption: The Lakers’ Kobe Bryant before a game Tuesday against the 76ers in Philadelphia, where the crowd stood and chanted his name.

summaries.body: After announcing that he will retire at the end of the season, Kobe Bryant returned to his hometown, Philadelphia, where his Lakers lost to the 76ers, their first win of the season.
A research group funded by Coca-Cola announced it was shutting down after months of accusations that its mission was to play down the link between soft drinks and obesity.
There may be as few as 30 wolves in the wild in Norway, but 11,571 people have registered for licenses to shoot 16 of them, a ratio of 723 hunters per wolf.

display_asset.caption: A hirsute David Letterman onstage at Ball State University, his alma mater, in Muncie, Ind. on Monday. He was there to interview the directors Spike Jonze and Bennett Miller.
display_asset.credit: A J Mast for The New York Times

summaries.body: Six months after retiring from late-night television, David Letterman moderated a conversation with the movie directors Spike Jonze and Bennett Miller.
After an N.C.A.A. suspension, the recruit Cheick Diallo made his Kansas debut with 13 points and six rebounds in a 94-61 victory over Loyola University Maryland.

posts.footer: Jeb Bush, during an appearance in Waterloo, Iowa, via Time

summaries.body: Should I be elected president, I would have my vice president — I think she will be a great partner. ... I mean, did I say that out loud?

display_asset.caption: The copyright on Hitler’s manifesto expires Dec. 31, giving a team of historians a chance to publish its edition.
display_asset.credit: Russ Juskalian for The New York Times

summaries.body: When the copyright on "Mein Kampf" expires on Dec. 31, a team of historians will release a heavily annotated edition that sets Hitler's manifesto in historical context.

display_asset.caption: Worried about the erosion of Tibetan culture and language, one man takes his concerns to Beijing, hoping media coverage and the courts can reverse what he sees as a systematic eradication.
display_asset.credit: Produced by By JONAH M. KESSEL

sectionFrontImages.credit: Gilles Sabrie for The New York Times

display_asset.title: A Tibetan’s Journey for Justice

summaries.body: In this nine-minute video, a man takes his concerns about the erosion of Tibetan culture and language to Beijing, hoping to reverse what he sees as a systematic eradication.

display_asset.caption: After being traded to Toronto in July, David Price went 9-1 and finished the season with a 2.45 earned run average, the best in the American League.

summaries.body: The Boston Red Sox are said to have signed the left-hander David Price for $217 million over seven years, which would be a record contract for a pitcher.
Researchers are trying to figure out if aggressive seagulls are contributing to a large increase in the number of young whale calves that are dying near Argentina.
An image of a dog with duct tape over its mouth went viral on Facebook this week and highlighted how animal rights supporters are playing detective online.
Lin-Manuel Miranda, who created the Broadway musical "Hamilton," will be contributing music to "Star Wars: The Force Awakens" in a collaboration with J.J. Abrams.

display_asset.caption: The artist “Brother Nut” vacuuming the dust near the Beijing National Stadium on Nov. 15, Day 87 of his project to turn the city’s pollution into a tangible brick.

summaries.body: Armed with a vacuum and red clay, a performance artist in Beijing sucked up dust from around the capital’s landmarks to create a solid brick of condensed pollution.

display_asset.caption: Dr. Thomas R. Frieden, the director of the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention.

summaries.body: The United States is still in danger of losing the war on AIDS, according to Dr. Thomas R. Frieden, the director of the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention.
A committee at Harvard will consider replacing the law school's logo, which is based on the family crest of a slave owner, following student complaints.

display_asset.caption: President Obama's State of the Union address on Jan. 20, 2015.

summaries.body: President Obama will deliver his final State of the Union address on Jan. 12, an early date designed in part to get out of the way of the presidential primary season.

display_asset.caption: At the Gotham Awards, the “Spotlight” winners included Liev Schreiber, left, the director Tom McCarthy, Rachel McAdams and John Slattery.

summaries.body: "Spotlight," about The Boston Globe's investigation into priests' sexual abuse of children, was the best-feature winner at the IFP Gotham Independent Film Awards.
About a dozen wooden fishing boats, some with dead bodies on board, have washed ashore in Japan in recent weeks.
Starting Tuesday, diners at chain restaurants in New York will see warnings on menus for high-salt items, under a rule believed to be the first of its kind in the country.

display_asset.caption: Lance Cpl. Joseph Scott Pemberton of the United States Marines, center, being escorted into court in Olongapo City, Philippines, on Tuesday.

summaries.body: A court in the Philippines convicted a United States Marine, Lance Cpl. Joseph Scott Pemberton, of homicide in the killing of a transgender woman last year.

display_asset.caption: Robert L. Dear Jr., right, appeared in court via live video with his public defender, Dan King, on Monday in Colorado Springs.

summaries.body: Robert L. Dear Jr., the man accused of fatally shooting three people at a Planned Parenthood clinic in Colorado Springs, made his first court appearance on Monday.

display_asset.credit: David Azia for The New York Times

summaries.body: At 22, Vince Staples is a rap star who is “not a fan of rap culture,” which he sees as one of many systems that set black people against one another.
To prevent shortages, Russia said it would wait several weeks to carry out a ban on produce from Turkey, which was a response to the shooting down of a Russian warplane.
A new study suggests that it is rare for any individual brain to be male or female, and that most contain a mixed bag of traits associated with both sexes.
Kobe Bryant did more of everything than almost anyone. He is in the Lakers’ top five in rebounds, assists, steals, blocks, free throws, 3-pointers, fouls and turnovers.

display_asset.credit: Photo by Brandon Thibodeaux for The New York Times

summaries.body: Chinese families are looking for a safe place to invest their renminbi. American real estate is an increasingly popular destination for their cash.
Broadway attendance broke records during Thanksgiving week as 12 shows brought in more than $1 million apiece.
